div.p: The MedicationAdministration and MedicationNotAdministered profiles represent the positive and negative statements for a medication administration. To ensure instances retrieved meet positive intent, applications should check the status element as illustrated in this example:
The following example illustrates accessing MedicationAdministration not done data:

pre.code:
// connectathon/fhir4/cql/EXM108_FHIR4-8.2.000.cql
define "No Low Dose Unfractionated Heparin Administration": [MedicationAdministrationNotDone: "Low Dose Unfractionated Heparin for VTE Prophylaxis"] VTEMedication where VTEMedication.status = 'not-done'

tr.td: Medication not administered using a value set to indicate what was not administered; indicates that none of the medications in the given value set were administered
Medication not administered using a code to indicate that a particular medication was not administered; indicates that a specific medication, by code, was not administered

div.p: Both of these example instances meet measure intent for exclusion as defined in the following example CQL:

pre.code: define "No VTE Prophylaxis Medication Administered or Ordered": ( ["MedicationAdministrationNotDone": "Low Dose Unfractionated Heparin for VTE Prophylaxis"] union ["MedicationAdministrationNotDone": "Low Molecular Weight Heparin for VTE Prophylaxis"] union ["MedicationAdministrationNotDone": "Injectable Factor Xa Inhibitor for VTE Prophylaxis"] union ["MedicationAdministrationNotDone": "Warfarin"] union ["MedicationAdministrationNotDone": "Rivaroxaban for VTE Prophylaxis"] ) MedicationAdminNotDone let MedicationNotDoneTiming: Global.GetExtension ( MedicationAdminNotDone, 'qicore-recorded' ).value return { id: MedicationAdminNotDone.id, MedicationStatusReason: MedicationAdminNotDone.statusReason, authoredOn: MedicationNotDoneTiming }

div.p: For a more complete discussion of representation of negation within QICore and quality improvement artifacts, see the Negation in QI Core topic.
